intro: Seseli montanum subsp. montanum, commonly known as mountain seseli, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, and it produces a distinctive, hollow stem. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
